qas.question: Name the Digimon video game that was released in 1999.
Name two types of toys the original Digimon bore a close resemblence to.

answers.text: Tamagotchi or nano Giga Pet toys

qas.question: When was the Digimon series created?
What influenced the look of the Digimons?

answers.text: Tamagotchi or nano Giga Pet toys

qas.question: In what year was the Digimon video game released?
What started with a series of real pets?
What cause the franchise to lose momentum?
What is aired for several seasons based on the films?
What American media for the original did you mom based on?

context: <b7_0>The franchise<b7_0/> was first created in <a0_0><a4_0>1997<a4_0/><a0_0/> as a series of virtual pets, akin to—and influenced in style by—the contemporary <a3_0><a5_0>Tamagotchi or nano Giga Pet toys<a5_0/><a3_0/>. The creatures were first designed to look cute and iconic even on the devices' small screens; later developments had them created with a harder-edged style influenced by <b11_0>American comics<b11_0/>. The franchise gained momentum with <b8_0>its first anime incarnation<b8_0/>, <a1_0>Digimon Adventure<a1_0/>, and <b9_0>an early video game<b9_0/>, <a2_0>Digimon World<a2_0/>, both released in <a6_0>1999<a6_0/>. Several seasons of the <b10_0>anime<b10_0/> and films based on them have aired, and the video game series has expanded into genres such as role-playing, racing, fighting, and MMORPGs. Other media forms have also been released.
